Prompt:
Please produce a short descriptive paragraph around 150 words long, what the PowerShell script is, anticipate its purpose. The response should include a Title, Description, Assumptions, and Dependencies.  \n Here is the PowerShell script to use for the descripion: 
# Example: .\List-UrlsInPage.ps1 -SourceSitePartUrl "SiteA" -PartTenant "contoso"
[CmdletBinding()]
param (
    [Parameter(Mandatory = $true, HelpMessage = "Source e.g. Intranet-Archive")]
    [string]$SourceSitePartUrl,
    [Parameter(Mandatory = $false, HelpMessage = "Organisation Url Fragment e.g. contoso ")]
    [string]$PartTenant,
    [string]$ReportName = "URL-Report.csv"
)
begin{

    $baseUrl = "https://$($PartTenant).sharepoint.com"
    $sourceSiteUrl = "$($baseUrl)/sites/$($SourceSitePartUrl)"
    
    Write-Host "Connecting to " $sourceSiteUrl
    
    # For MFA Tenants - Interactive opens a browser window
    Connect-PnPOnline -Url $sourceSiteUrl -Interactive
    $filter = '<View>' +
                '<Query>' +
                    '<Where>' +
                        '<And>' +
                            '<Eq>'+
                                '<FieldRef Name="FSObjType" />'+
                                '<Value Type="Integer">0</Value>'+
                            '</Eq>'+
                            '<Neq>'+
                                '<FieldRef Name="_SPSitePageFlags" />'+
                                '<Value Type="Text">{Template}}</Value>'+
                            '</Neq>'+
                        '</And>' +
                    '</Where>' +
                '</Query>' +
            '</View>'

    $loc = Get-Location
    $reportPath = "$($loc)\$($ReportName)"

    '"WebTitle","WebUrl","PageFileName","WebPartTitle","LinkTitle","LinkUrl"' | Out-File $reportPath
}
process{

    Write-Host "Reading pages in site..."

    $web = Get-PnPWeb -Includes Title,Url
    $webTitle = $web.Title
    $webUrl = $web.Url
    
    $pages = Get-PnPListItem -List "SitePages" -Query $filter
            
    Foreach($page in $pages){

        $file = $page.FieldValues["FileLeafRef"]

        Write-Host " Processing Page $($file)" -ForegroundColor Cyan

        $components = Get-PnPPageComponent -Page $file
        
        # To find the Web Part ID:
        # Get-PnPPageComponent -Page "MyPage.aspx" -ListAvailable

        # You can filter based on type of web part
        # c70391ea-0b10-4ee9-b2b4-006d3fcad0cd QuickLinksWebPart
        $summaryLinks = $components | Where-Object { $_.WebPartId -eq 'c70391ea-0b10-4ee9-b2b4-006d3fcad0cd'}
        Write-Host "Found $($summaryLinks.Count) Summary Links" -ForegroundColor Yellow

        $summaryLinks | Foreach-Object{

            $wpTitle = $_.title
            Write-Host "Web Part Title: $($wpTitle)"

            $serverContent = $_.ServerProcessedContent | ConvertFrom-Json -AsHashTable
            $itemCount = $serverContent.links.Count

            #{htmlStrings, searchablePlainTexts, imageSources, links...}
            Write-Host "Item Count: $($itemCount)"
            
            For($i = 0; $i -lt $itemCount; $i++){

                $titlePath = "items[$($i)].title"
                $urlPath = "items[$($i)].sourceItem.url"

                $lnkTitle = $serverContent.searchablePlainTexts.$titlePath
                $lnkUrl = $serverContent.links.$urlPath

                if($lnkTitle -and $lnkUrl){

                    Write-Host "    Link Title: $($lnkTitle)" -ForegroundColor Cyan
                    Write-Host "    Link URL: $($lnkUrl)" -ForegroundColor Cyan
    
                    $line = '"' + $webTitle + '","' + `
                        $webUrl + '","' + `
                        $file + '","' + `
                        $wpTitle  + '","' + `
                        $lnkTitle + '","' + `
                        $lnkUrl + '"'
    
                    $line | Out-File $reportPath -Append
    
                }
            }

        }
    }
}
SystemPrompt: You are a helpful analyser of PowerShell scripts that will be used to produce title and description of what the script intended function. Intended to give readers of the PowerShell script, a friendly message to describe what the script is about. The PowerShell scripts can be based on the Microsoft services such as Microsoft 365, SharePoint, Azure, Power Platform, Teams, Security and Compliance. The reponses should be in English and in JSON Format using this example: { "Title": "Title of the Script", "Purpose": "Purpose of the Script", "LongDescription": "Describe what Powershell Script does", "Dependencies": ["Connect-PnPOnline", "Get-PnPListItem"],  "Assumptions": [{ "SourceSitePartURLRequired": true, "TenantFilterOptional": false }]}.   If you don't know the answer, just say that you don't know, don't try to make up an answer

LocalModelResults.ModelResultDescription:
{
  "Title": "List URLs in SharePoint Site Pages",
  "Purpose": "The script extracts and lists all the links from each page within a specified SharePoint site, including details like web title, URL of the webpage where it's found, file name on which link is present (if applicable), Web Part Title for contextual understanding, Link Titles pointing to other resources or pages in/outside the network and their corresponding URLs.",
  "LongDescription": "This PowerShell script connects with a SharePoint site using provided SitePartUrl. It then fetches all web parts from each page on that specific website where it's run by filtering out non-page items (like documents). For every link found, the title and URL are extracted along with additional details like Link Titles pointing to other resources or pages in/outside of network if available.",
  "Dependencies": ["Connect-PnPOnline", "Get-PnPListItem"],
  "Assumptions": [{"SourceSitePartURLRequired": true, "TenantFilterOptional": false}]
}

ModelResultObject.Title: List URLs in SharePoint Site Pages
ModelResultObject.Purpose: The script extracts and lists all the links from each page within a specified SharePoint site, including details like web title, URL of the webpage where it's found, file name on which link is present (if applicable), Web Part Title for contextual understanding, Link Titles pointing to other resources or pages in/outside the network and their corresponding URLs.
ModelResultObject.LongDescription: This PowerShell script connects with a SharePoint site using provided SitePartUrl. It then fetches all web parts from each page on that specific website where it's run by filtering out non-page items (like documents). For every link found, the title and URL are extracted along with additional details like Link Titles pointing to other resources or pages in/outside of network if available.
